title: Create readme.md for NFTs owning NFTs
body: Create readme.md for NFTs owning NFTs

title: SC upgrade tool
body:
Smart contract upgrade tool that can upgrade contracts up to version 0.39.0 (for now).

It is easy to expand with code for new versions. It also has a default implementation that simply bumps versions in the crate configs.

The upgrade tool is part of the meta crate, which can now also be called as a standalone application. 

Also refactored the meta crate CLI arguments using `clap`. Aside from the more concise implementation, we also have the following help:

```
MultiversX smart contract meta-programming tools and build system

Usage: sc-meta [OPTIONS] [COMMAND]

Commands:
  build      Builds contract(s) for deploy on the blockchain.
  build-dbg  Builds contract(s) with symbols and WAT.
  twiggy     Builds contract(s) and generate twiggy reports.
  clean      Clean the Rust project and the output folder.
  snippets   Generates a snippets project, based on the contract ABI.
  upgrade    Upgrades a contract to the latest version. Multiple contract crates are allowed.
  help       Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)

Options:
      --no-abi-git-version  Skips loading the Git version into the ABI
  -h, --help                Print help
  -V, --version             Print version


The MultiversX smart contract Meta crate can be used in two ways:
    A. Import it into a contract's specific meta-crate. 
       There it will receive access to the contract ABI generator. 
       Based on that it is able to build the contract and apply various tools.
       This part also contains the multi-contract config infrastructure.

    B. Use it as a standalone tool.
       It can be used to automatically upgrade contracts from one version to the next.
```

Running the upgrade tool produces a colorful output:

![Screenshot from 2023-01-17 18-06-20](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26074099/212954159-d4f2f307-2a32-4c55-8e99-297c38b3273c.png)

title: Release: sc 0.39.0, codec 0.17.0, chain-vm 0.1.0, chain-scenario-format 0.19.0, sdk 0.1.0
renamed mandos -> scenario in variables and local funcs
StepHandler trait to abstract away creating&executing scenarios
body:
1. Nice trait, but more importantly:
2. Renaming `mandos_*` -> `*_step`

title: tests ignored instead of commented out
body:
Figured out this neat trick a while ago.

Better not have commented tests, or commented code in general.

title: Scenario test method rename in contracts
ScenarioWorld facade
body: We want to avoid exposing the BlockchainMock from the VM directly to tests, especially since we are going to refactor a lot around there.

title: crate reorg: `mx-*` prefix renamed to `multiversx-*`
body: The full crate `multiversx-` prefix is preferable and can prevent many ambiguities, even though it is a little more verbose.

title: removed old tutorial book
body: It was a draft that got superseded by docs.elrond.com. It's time to go.

title: crate reorg: mx-sc-debug split into mx-sc-scenario and mx-chain-vm
body:
Preparing the crates for the first release.

The VM is not completely split, but at least the part that SCs interact with is its own crate, `mx-sc-scenario`.

The VM crate gets its own root folder.
We introduce a `sdk` folder, where erdrs is also going to stay.

I tried to keep all changes in the contracts to a minimum.

title: Add migrateUserName builtin function mock
body: - add mock for the `migrateUserName` builtin function, which migrates a username from `.elrond` to a `.x` suffix

title: Rebranding in crates and readmes
body:
Additional renames in crate Cargo.toml files and readme files.

Still a few instances of "elrond" and "mandos" remaining, will be changed after fixes in the documentation and erdrs integration.

title: Fix wrong attributes after update and transfer
meta twiggy post-processing
body:
It is now possible to run twiggy directly from the `meta` crate.

There are individual flags, but it is easier to just call `cargo run twiggy` in the meta crate directly.

title: meta CLI args refactor
body:
Preliminary refactor before adding twiggy functionality.

Separated parsing of CLI arguments from the execution.
